tit.j: 川田神社 (甲賀市土山町)

sen.j: 川田神社（かわたじんじゃ）は、滋賀県甲賀市土山町に鎮座する神社である。
sen.e: Kawata-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tsuchiyama-cho, Koga City, Shiga Prefecture.
Kawata-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tsuchiyama-cho, Koga City, Shiga Prefecture.
Kawata-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Tsuchiyama-cho, Koga City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 仁和元年に伊勢国から滝原大神を勧請したと伝わる。
sen.e: It is believed that this shrine was established in 885 by ceremonially transferring a divided tutelary deity of Takihara-no-Okami in Ise Province.
It is believed that this shrine was established in 885 by ceremonially transferring a divided tutelary deity of Takihara-no-Okami in Ise Province.
It is believed that this shrine was established in 885 by ceremonially transferring a divided tutelary deity of Takihara-no-Okami in Ise Province.

sen.j: 延喜式名神大社の論社である。
sen.e: This shrine is a Ronja, shrines considered to be descendants of Engishikimyojin-taisha Shrine (shrines listed under the Jinmyocho [the list of deities] of Engishiki [codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).

This shrine is a Ronja, shrines considered to be descendants of Engishikimyojin-taisha Shrine (shrines listed under the Jinmyocho [the list of deities] of Engishiki [codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).

This shrine is a Ronja, shrines considered to be descendants of Engishikimyojin-taisha Shrine (shrines listed under the Jinmyocho [the list of deities] of Engishiki [codes and procedures on national rites and prayers]).

sen.j: 高安大明神とも川田滝大明神とも称したが、明治9年に現社号に改められた。
sen.e: Referred to as either Takayasu Daimyojin or Kawadataki Daimyojin, the shrine was renamed the present name, Kawata-jinja Shrine in 1876.
Referred to as either Takayasu Daimyojin or Kawadataki Daimyojin, the shrine was renamed the present name, Kawata-jinja Shrine in 1876.
Referred to as either Takayasu Daimyojin or Kawadataki Daimyojin, the shrine was renamed the present name, Kawata-jinja Shrine in 1876.

sen.j: 鎮座地は頓宮に当たり、倭姫命が白川で禊ぎを行ったとの伝承がある。
sen.e: The place of enshrinement is in Tongu of Koga City, which has the legend that Yamatohime-no-mikoto (a daughter of the Emperor Suinin) performed the ritual ablutions in Shira-kawa River.
The place of enshrinement is in Tongu of Koga City, which has the legend that Yamatohime no mikoto (a daughter of the Emperor Suinin) performed the ritual ablutions in Shira-kawa River.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを外し、Yamatohime no mikotoとしました。
sen.e: The place of enshrinement is in Tongu of Koga City, which has the legend that Yamatohime no mikoto (a daughter of the Emperor Suinin) performed the ritual ablutions in Shira-kawa River.
It was designated as the prefectural shrine in the past.
It was designated as the prefectural shrine in the past.
It was designated as the prefectural shrine in the past.
